Hi to all,
I would like to simulate a combustion process in a piston and I'=
ve
already simulated it like a reactor with a moving wall obtaining good
re=
sults. However, I am now trying to simulate the combustion process
with a s=
eries of adiabatic reactors because I need to do some
operations on the the=
rmodynamic properties between two timestps. At
the end of every timestep I =
save variables like gas temperature,
pressure and composition and, after do=
ing what I need to do, I
re-initialize a new reactor with the initial condi=
tions which I've
computed. Doing it I've encountered a big problem: the rea=
ctor afeter
the first timesetp doesn't evaluate the chemestry in it. In oth=
er
words it modifies the composition of the mixture only in the first
times=
tep, during the others it doesn't do anything regarding the
reactions in it=
 so I cannot evaluate the correct behavior of the gas
during the compressio=
n and expansion strokes.
Somebody has ideas or suggestions about it?

Daniele
